The event brought students from around the world together to design innovative solutions to local problems, and included meetings with a variety civic leaders.<ref name=bootcamp>Dalakian, Glen. [http://www.wamda.com/2012/12/gems-global-entrepreneurship-bootcamp-brings-students-from-around-the-world-to-dubai "GEMS Global Entrepreneurship Bootcamp Brings Students From Around the World to Dubai"]. ''Wamda''. 13 December 2012.</ref> GEMS also provides teacher training for over 70 government schools in Abu Dhabi.<ref>Smith, Beckie. [http://thepienews.com/pie-chat/dino-varkey-gems-education-uae/ "Dino Varkey, GEMS Education, UAE"]. ''The Pie''. 23 January 2015.</ref>
In keeping up with technological advances, in 2009 GEMS in the UAE implemented a customized [[virtual learning environment]] (VLE) across its schools;<ref>Giado, Imthishan. [http://www.arabianbusiness.com/gems-unveil-new-learning-experience-in-feb-80467.html "GEMS to unveil new learning experience in Feb"]. ''[[Arabian Business]]''. 2 February 2009.</ref> and in 2013 GEMS began installing a [[Bring Your Own Device]] (BYOD) wireless system in all of its schools in the UAE.<ref>Paye, Tom. [http://www.cnmeonline.com/news/gems-education-adopts-byod-with-aruba/ "GEMS Education adopts BYOD with Aruba"]. ''Computer News Middle East''. 4 March 2013.</ref> In February 2015 GEMS launched the Blended Learning Plaza, housed at its GEMS Wellington Academy–Silicon{{nbsp}}Oasis, located in Dubai's [[Silicon Oasis]]; the facility provides the latest technology in education, enabling collaborative, online, and [[blended learning]] opportunities.<ref>Nazzal, Noor. [http://gulfnews.com/news/uae/education/gems-launches-blended-learning-plaza-at-the-gems-wellington-academy-1.1450443 "GEMS launches Blended Learning Plaza at the GEMS Wellington Academy"]. ''[[Gulf News]]''. 2 February 2015.</ref><ref>[http://www.systemsintegrationasia.com/latest/installations/dubai-gems-education-selects-prysm-blended-learning-plaza/ "DUBAI: GEMS Education Selects Prysm for Blended Learning Plaza"]. ''SystemsIntegrationAsia.com''. Retrieved 4 January 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.albawaba.com/business/pr/gems-education-651570 "GEMS Education Inaugurates Blended Learning Plaza at GEMS Wellington Academy – Silicon Oasis"]. ''[[Al Bawaba]]''. 2 February 2015.</ref>
GEMS Education in the UAE has partnered with [[Microsoft]] in several ways. In 2011 Microsoft launched its "Innovate, Teach, Inspire" programme in GEMS schools in the UAE; the programme trains GEMS teachers in the UAE on several Microsoft tools, including Microsoft Office, PowerPoint, Windows Live Movie Maker, Windows Live Blogging, and SkyDrive.<ref>[http://dubib.com/news/4209_microsoft-to-launch-innovate-teach-inspire-project-in-united-arab-emirates-in-collaboration-with-gems-education "Microsoft to launch Innovate, Teach, Inspire project in United Arab Emirates in collaboration with GEMS Education"]. ''Dubib.com''. 17 March 2011.</ref><ref>Enzer, Georgina. [http://www.itp.net/584199-microsoft-gems-debut-ict-education-project "Microsoft, GEMS debut ICT education project"]. ''[[ITP Publishing Group|ITP]]''. 17 March 2011.</ref> Beginning in early 2015 Microsoft granted all GEMS students in the UAE free full access to [[Office 365|Office 365 Pro Plus]], which includes applications such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Access, Publisher, Outlook, Lync, and InfoPath, and allows students to run Office on up to five machines and mobile devices across multiple platforms.<ref>Chami, Samer. [http://www.absolutegeeks.com/2015/01/12/microsoft-and-gems-education-join-efforts-in-the-uae/ "Microsoft and GEMS Education Join Efforts in the UAE"]. ''AbsoluteGeeks.com''. 12 January 2015.</ref> Microsoft also offered students a series of seminars and online workshops in the various Office 365 Pro Plus technologies.<ref>Ingham, David. [http://www.educationjournalme.com/news/gems-students-and-teachers-get-to-grips-with-office-365_101 "GEMS students and teachers get to grips with Office 365"]. ''EducationJournalME.com''. 1 July 2015.</ref>
In December 2015 GEMS Education and the [[UAE Ministry of Education]] launched an annual UAE National Teacher Prize. The winner receives [[United Arab Emirates dirham|AED]]1{{nbsp}}million, and the 21 top nominees train outside the country at some of the best educational institutions in the world.<ref>[http://teachuae.com/uae-ministry-of-education-and-gems-education-announce-uae-national-teacher-prize/ "UAE Ministry of Education and GEMS Education announce UAE National Teacher Prize"]. ''Teach UAE''. 25 November 2015.</ref><ref>[http://www.thenational.ae/uae/education/uae-national-teacher-prize-established "UAE National Teacher Prize established"]. ''[[The National (Abu Dhabi)|The National]]''. 25 November 2015.</ref> Winners of the prize, now called the Emirates Innovative Teacher Award, are announced annually in February at the Government Summit.<ref>Nazzal, Noor. [http://gulfnews.com/news/uae/government/emirati-teacher-wins-dh1m-award-1.1668576 "Emirati teacher wins Dh1m award"]. ''[[Gulf News]]''. 8 February 2016. </ref><ref>[[WAM (Emirates news agency)|WAM]]. [http://www.emirates247.com/news/government/mohammed-honours-innovative-teachers-2016-02-09-1.620304 "Mohammed honours innovative teachers"]. ''[[Emirates 24/7]]''. 9 February 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.educationjournalme.com/news/emirati-teacher-from-rak-bags-emirates-innovative-teacher-award-_380 "Emirati teacher from RAK bags Emirates Innovative Teacher Award"]. ''Education Journal''. 9 February 2016.</ref>
=====Selected individual schools===== [[GEMS World Academy]] in Dubai, which opened in 2008, is the company's flagship school, and is the most expensive school in Dubai.<ref name=birth/><ref name=BloombergRefDec31>{{cite news|last1=Martin|first1=Matthew|title=Cashing in on Dubai's School-Seat Lottery|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150119153913/http://www.businessweekme.com/Bloomberg/newsmid/190/newsid/343|url=http://businessweekme.com/Bloomberg/newsmid/190/newsid/343|archivedate=19 January 2015|work=Bloomberg Businessweek|date=31 Dec 2014}}</ref> An International Baccalaureate school, its enrolment consists of approximately 2,000 students from more than 80 nationalities.<ref name=block/> It has a custom-designed planetarium; facilities for arts, sciences, and languages; a robotics lab; TV, radio, and recording studios; and music rooms with Steinway pianos. Its sports facilities include an Olympic-sized swimming pool, football field, running track, tennis courts, squash courts, skating park, gymnasium, and sports hall with retractable seating. It also has a 650-seat auditorium; an amphitheatre; cafés and a roof-top garden; and on-site breakfast or afternoon clubs for parents to meet teachers.<ref name=lewis/><ref>Murphy, Adrian. [http://www.emirates247.com/eb247/news/national/is-this-gem-the-best-school-on-the-planet-2008-08-23-1.224877 "Is this gem the best school on the planet?"]. ''[[Emirates 24/7]]''. 23 August 2008.</ref>
[[Our Own English High School]] in Dubai, now exclusively for girls, has an enrolment of 10,000 and tuition that is approximately one-tenth that of GEMS World Academy, while still maintaining academic excellence.<ref name=lewis/><ref name=block/> It is the world's largest single-location girls school, offers an Indian curriculum, and has a waiting list of several thousand.<ref name=block/>
[[GEMS American Academy, Abu Dhabi]] was opened in 2011 by Bill Clinton.<ref>[[WAM (Emirates News Agency)|WAM]]. [http://www.khaleejtimes.com/article/20111213/ARTICLE/312139975/1002 "Clinton opens GEMS American Academy-Abu Dhabi"]. ''[[Khaleej Times]]''. 13 December 2011. </ref> In September 2013 the school hosted basketball star [[Kobe Bryant]] for a basketball skills clinic for selected students, as part of the Kobe Bryant Health and Fitness Weekend in the UAE, co-sponsored by GEMS Education;<ref name=kobeaa>[http://www.albawaba.com/business/pr/gems-american-academy-kobe-bryant-519400 "GEMS American Academy in Abu Dhabi to host basketball skills clinic with Kobe Bryant"]. ''[[Al Bawaba]]''. 10 September 2013.</ref><ref>[http://english.alarabiya.net/en/sports/2013/09/26/NBA-fans-in-the-UAE-welcome-basketball-legand-Kobe-Bryant-.html "UAE's NBA fans meet basketball legend Kobe Bryant"]. ''[[Al Arabiya]]''. 26 September 2013.</ref><ref>Gomes, Alaric. [http://gulfnews.com/sport/basketball/nba-fans-welcome-kobe-bryant-to-dubai-1.1235629 "NBA fans welcome Kobe Bryant to Dubai"]. ''[[Gulf News]]''. 25 September 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www.khaleejtimes.com/article/20130820/ARTICLE/308209890/1050 "NBA star Kobe Bryant set to enthrall UAE fans"]. ''[[Khaleej Times]]''. 31 August 2013.</ref> the clinic was also streamed live to GEMS World Academy in Dubai.<ref name=kobeaa/> In 2015 a team of three students from the school competed at [[New York University]]'s annual Digital Forensics Competition, along with 11 other teams chosen from over 800 teams around the world.<ref>[http://www.khaleejtimes.com/nation/education/gems-students-chosen-for-forensics-contest "GEMS students chosen for forensics contest"]. ''[[Khaleej Times]]''. 15 November 2015.</ref>
In 2012 [[Cambridge International School, Dubai]] was named by Microsoft as one of the Innovative Pathfinder Schools from around the world, and it is the only school in the UAE to be thus recognised.<ref>[http://www.albawaba.com/business/pr/microsoft-gems-454159 "Microsoft names GEMS Cambridge International School–Dubai as the only Global Pathfinder School in the UAE"]. ''[[Al Bawaba]]''. 4 December 2012.</ref> In 2015 the school, which follows the British curriculum, was recognized as the top school for [[Modern Standard Arabic|Arabic]] in Dubai, in the Education Perfect global language-learning competition's second year to include Dubai.<ref>[https://www.zawya.com/story/GEMS_Education_School_places_first_for_Arabic_in_Dubai_in_global_language_learning_competition-ZAWYA20150420115720/ "GEMS Education School places first for Arabic in Dubai in global language learning competition"]. ''[[Zawya]]''. 20 April 2015.</ref>
In September 2014 GEMS opened GEMS Sports Academy, which is a two-year full-time education within a professional sports-academy development programme, in Dubai. The sports academy is initially hosted at GEMS Wellington Academy–Silicon{{nbsp}}Oasis, and offers a two-year International Baccalaureate diploma programme with professional athletics training.<ref>Dhal, Sharmila. [http://gulfnews.com/news/uae/general/registration-begins-for-new-gems-sports-school-1.1329478 "Registration begins for new Gems sports school"]. ''[[Gulf News]]''. 7 May 2014.</ref><ref>Pinto, Denzil. [http://sport360.com/article/school-sports/21550/gems-creates-uaes-first-ever-school-sport "GEMS creates UAE's first ever school of sport"]. ''[[Sport 360]]''. 25 May 2014.</ref>
====Elsewhere in MENA==== In 2010 GEMS took over the management of Kingdom Schools, a subsidiary of [[Kingdom Holding Company]], in [[Riyadh]], Saudi Arabia.<ref>[http://www.arabnews.com/node/355639 "Kingdom Schools announces tie-up with GEMS Education"]. ''[[Arab News]]''. 21 September 2010.</ref><ref>Lippman, Thomas W. [https://books.google.com/books?id=bmJsfmqb-j0C&pg=PA132 ''Saudi Arabia on the Edge: The Uncertain Future of an American Ally'']. Potomac Books, 2012. p. 132.</ref> The two school campuses, one for boys and one for girls, cover kindergarten through high school and were established in 2000.<ref name=turning>[http://www.gemsedsolutions.com/turning-around-school-saudi-arabia "Kingdom Schools - Turning around schools in Saudi Arabia"]. ''GEMSedsolutions.com''. 2015.</ref><ref>[https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=69466386 Company Overview of Kingdom Schools Company]. ''[[Bloomberg Business]]''. Retrieved 27 January 2016.</ref> The school caters to affluent mainly Saudi families, and teaches a bilingual English-Arabic and international curriculum.<ref name=turning/><ref name=advanced>Al Mulhem, Nasser. [http://www.advanc-ed.org/oasis2/u/par/accreditation/summary/pdf;jsessionid=E75BBDA455EB0C66CCEBF7572BD67BFD?institutionId=35682 ''Executive Summary: Kingdom Schools'']. AdvancED. ''Advanc-ED.org''. 9 January 2013.</ref> It contains a number of sports and recreation facilities, science and language labs, and libraries, and includes internet and technological access for each student.<ref name=advanced/><ref>[http://www.itp.net/472511-kingdom-schools-embraces-%E2%80%98e-learning%E2%80%99/ "Kingdom Schools embraces 'e-learning'"]. ''[[ITP Publishing Group|ITP]]''. 11 June 2001.</ref> In 2012 the school was recognized for being eco-friendly, and for being the first school in Saudi Arabia to adopt basic sustainability concepts.<ref>[http://www.mideast-times.com/left_news.php?newsid=3115 "Eng. Al Maiman: 'Kingdom Schools is the first to adapt the concept of basic sustainability elements'"]. ''[[Middle East Times]]''. October 2012.</ref>
In September 2012 GEMS opened The World Academy in [[King Abdullah Economic City]] (KAEC) in [[Saudi Arabia]]. The academy, which covers kindergarten through high school, is the new city's first school.<ref name=standards>[http://www.arabnews.com/kaec-world-academy-sets-new-standards "KAEC World Academy sets new standards"]. ''[[Arab News]]''. 18 September 2012.</ref> It offers the International American curriculum leading to International Baccalaureate certification, and was designed to meet international educational standards in the context of Saudi Arabian cultural values.<ref name=standards/><ref name=kaec>[http://www.kaec.net/press_releases/kaec-constructing-more-educational-facilities-for-the-world-academy/ "KAEC constructing more educational facilities for The World Academy"]. [[King Abdullah Economic City]]. ''KAET.net''. 4 August 2014.</ref> Its facilities, curriculum, and library feature current electronic devices and accessibility, and it contains an English language center for improving English skills.<ref name=standards /><ref name=kaec/> In 2014 construction began to expand the school and add science labs and new design and technology facilities.<ref>''[[Saudi Gazette]]''. [https://www.zawya.com/story/KAEC_expands_The_World_Academy_facilities-ZAWYA20140807042200/ "KAEC expands The World Academy facilities"]. ''[[Zawya]]''. 7 August 2014.</ref>
In [[Egypt]], GEMS opened Windrose Academy in Cairo in 2013, offering a blended curriculum focused on the [[National Curriculum of England]].<ref>[http://www.gemseducation.com/choosing-a-school/find-a-school/windrose-academy/ Windrose Academy]. ''GEMSeducation.com''. Retrieved 29 January 2016.</ref> GEMS Academy–Alexandria opened in 2014, with an English and French curriculum.<ref>[http://www.gemseducation.com/choosing-a-school/find-a-school/gems-academy-alexandria/ GEMS Academy Alexandria]. ''GEMSeducation.com''. Retrieved 29 January 2016.</ref>
The company opened its first school in [[Qatar]], GEMS American Academy, in September 2014. The school is located in [[Al Wakrah (municipality)|Al Wakrah]], and offers an American curriculum based around the United States [[Common Core State Standards Initiative|Common Core State Standards]], while still valuing the Islamic faith and Qatar’s language, traditions, history, and culture.<ref name=qatar>[http://www.qatar-tribune.com/viewnews.aspx?n=08F032A3-F4DC-4481-9F2E-38966B234D35&d=20140827 "1st Gems-owned school to open in Sept"]. ''[[Qatar Tribune]]''. 27 August 2014.</ref><ref>Trenwith, Courtney. [http://www.arabianbusiness.com/gems-first-qatar-school-ready-open-562670.html "GEMS' first Qatar school ready to open"]. ''[[Arabian Business]]''. 27 August 2014.</ref> It provides after-school activities including Spanish club, cultural dance, choir, robotics, and yoga.<ref>[http://www.qatarisbooming.com/article/gems-american-academy-qatar-welcomes-first-pupils "GEMS American Academy Qatar welcomes first pupils"]. ''Qatar Is Booming''. 19 October 2014.</ref> It opened initially for kindergarten through grade 5, with plans to subsequently expand through high school.<ref name=qatar/><ref>[http://www.dohafamily.com/Schools-and-Tutoring-Services/index.php/name/GEMS-American-Academy/listing/33233/ "Schools and Tutoring Services: GEMS American Academy"]. ''Doha Family''. Retrieved 28 January 2016.</ref>
In the fall of 2015 GEMS opened a school featuring the [[National Curriculum (England, Wales and Northern Ireland)|English National Curriculum]] in Qatar.<ref>[http://www.thepeninsulaqatar.com/news/qatar/358994/new-private-school-with-english-national-curriculum-opens "New private school with English National Curriculum opens"]. ''[[The Peninsula (newspaper)|The Peninsula]]''. 16 November 2015.</ref> The school, GEMS Wellington School–Qatar, is located in Al Wakrah and opened with pre-school through grade 6, with plans to expand through high school in later years.<ref>[http://www.qatar-tribune.com/viewnews.aspx?n=C3489C1D-D443-4E73-9DE1-8DFF797E48D8&d=20151118 "Gems Wellington School opens in Qatar"]. ''[[Qatar Tribune]]''. 18 November 2015.</ref>
===GEMS in the United Kingdom===
GEMS acquired and opened schools in England beginning in 2003. Most of its schools in the UK are independent coeducational day schools.
In the fall of 2003 it acquired Sherborne House in [[Hampshire]] – a school for ages 3–11 that was founded in 1933.<ref name=sherborne>[http://privateschoolsinhampshire.co.uk/sherborne-house-school/ Sherborne House School, Chandler’s Ford, Hampshire]. ''PrivateSchoolsInHampshire.co.uk''. Retrieved 4 February 2016.</ref> It is sited on a four-acre campus,<ref name=sherborne/> and in 2013 a new block of classrooms was added.<ref>[http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/news/10663264.New_block_at_Sherborne_House_School__Chandler_s_Ford__opened_by_MP/ "New block at Sherborne House School, Chandler's Ford, opened by MP"]. ''[[Southern Daily Echo|Daily Echo]]''. 9 September 2013 .</ref> The school offers scholarships in academic subjects, art, sport, and music,<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=RYJMAQAAQBAJ&pg=PA1222 ''Independent Schools Yearbook 2012-2013'']. A&C Black, 2013. p. 1222.</ref><ref>Gabbitas Education. [https://books.google.com/books?id=PatXXNEWx_0C&pg=PA308 ''The Independent Schools Guide 2012-2013: A Fully Comprehensive Guide to Independent Education in the United Kingdom'']. Kogan Page Publishers, 2013. p. 308.</ref> and has a special needs provisions unit.<ref>Gabbitas Education. [https://books.google.com/books?id=IaMLb1XeH5YC&pg=PA478 ''Schools for Special Needs 2012-2013: The Complete Guide to Special Needs Education in the United Kingdom'']. Kogan Page Publishers, 2012. p. 478.</ref> In 2014 the school received the [[Artsmark|Artsmark Gold]] award designation from [[Arts Council England]].<ref>Higgitt, Dave. [http://edquarter.com/Article/gold_award_for_sherborne_house "Gold award for Sherborne House"]. ''EdQuarter.com''. 7 December 2014.</ref>
Also in the fall of 2003 GEMS acquired [[Bury Lawn School]] in [[Milton Keynes]], northwest of London. The school had been founded in 1970 and was moved to its current site in 1987, and it caters to ages 3–18.<ref name=mkheritage/> In 2005, parents complained publicly following the departure of the fourth head teacher in two years; some parents had also objected to the increase in class sizes from 18 to 24 after GEMS acquired the school.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/education/4579787.stm "Parents' revolt at private school"]. ''[[BBC News]]''. 25 May 2005.</ref><ref>Shaw, Michael. [https://www.tes.com/article.aspx?storycode=398203 "Economy class private schools"]. ''[[TES (magazine)|TES]]''. 30 July 2004.</ref><ref name=ward>Ward, Lucy. [https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2004/aug/17/schools.publicschools "Model schools for a niche market"]. ''[[The Guardian]]''. 16 August 2004.</ref> GEMS subsequently withdrew from plans to sponsor two [[Academy (English school)|academies]], or state-funded independent schools, in Milton Keynes.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/education/4091220.stm "Firm pulls out of academy scheme"]. ''[[BBC News]]''. 14 June 2005.</ref>
At Bury Lawn GEMS added a new sports hall, music room, dance and drama studio, ICT lab, and mathematics department in 2004,<ref name=mkheritage>[http://www.mkheritage.co.uk/dmk/exhibitions/22/13.pdf Bury Lawn School]. Milton Keynes Heritage Association. Retrieved 11 February 2016.</ref> and in 2006 it refurbished the science department and added four new labs.<ref name=mkheritage/> In September 2011 the school was renamed after urban designer [[Melvin M. Webber]], who was responsible for Milton Keynes' unique city layout, and it became the [[Webber Independent School]], with a new head teacher and a new focus.<ref>[http://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/business/business-news/school-s-new-identity-for-start-of-term-1-2977198 "School’s new identity for start of term"]. ''[[Milton Keynes Citizen]]''. 2 September 2011.</ref><ref>[http://www.perception-pr.co.uk/bury-lawn-reveals-its-new-image.html "Bury Lawn Reveals Its New Image"]. ''Perception-PR.co.uk''. September 2011.</ref> In 2014 Webber Independent was academically the best-performing school in Milton Keynes in GCSEs,<ref>Andrews, Laim. [http://citiblog.co.uk/2015/01/31/school-league-tables-show-decline-in-milton-keynes-students-getting-five-or-more-a-cs/ "School League Tables Show Decline in Milton Keynes Students Getting Five or More A*-Cs"]. ''CitiBlog''. 31 January 2015.</ref> and in 2015 it increased its scores despite nationwide downward trends in GCSE results.<ref>[http://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/local/webber-independent-school-celebrates-best-ever-gcse-results-1-6915452 "Webber Independent School celebrates best ever GCSE results"]. ''[[Milton Keynes Citizen]]''. 20 August 2015.</ref> In [[A levels]], Webber Independent was also the top-performing school in Milton Keynes from 2014–15.<ref>[http://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/local/results-webber-independent-school-delighted-1-6902360 "Results: Webber Independent School 'delighted'"]. ''[[Milton Keynes Citizen]]''. 13 August 2015.</ref>
In 2004 GEMS acquired the site for [[Sherfield School]] – the historic estate Sherfield Manor in Hampshire, set on more than 70 acres.<ref name=ukb/><ref name=manor>Garfield, Richard. [http://www.basingstokegazette.co.uk/memories/4235680.Noble_and_rich_history_of_Sherfield_Manor/ "Noble and rich history of Sherfield Manor"]. ''[[Basingstoke Gazette]]''. 25 March 2009.</ref> The site had previously been a girls' boarding school, [[North Foreland Lodge]], since 1947.<ref name=manor/> GEMS started Sherfield School as a coeducational day school, and added boarding facilities in 2010 and 2015,<ref name=ukb>[http://www.ukboardingschools.com/schools/sherfield-school/ Sherfield School]. ''UKboardingschools.com''. Retrieved 29 February 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.basingstokegazette.co.uk/news/13489712.Plans_for_new_accommodation_block_at_Sherfield_School_unveiled/ "Plans for new accommodation block at Sherfield School unveiled"]. ''[[Basingstoke Gazette]]''. 22 July 2015.</ref> including residential buildings for students with autism and severe learning disabilities.<ref>Roberts, Emily. [http://www.basingstokegazette.co.uk/news/12902459.New_residential_buildings_opened_at_north_Hampshire_school "New residential buildings opened at Sherfield School"]. ''[[Basingstoke Gazette]]''. 21 April 2015</ref> The school is GEMS' flagship "premium" school in the UK, with fees higher than its mid-range schools.<ref name=ward/><ref>Cassidy, Sarah. [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/is-this-a-no-frills-revolution-5351810.html "Is this a no-frills revolution?"]. ''[[The Independent]]''. 22 September 2004.</ref> It includes extensive sports grounds, facilities, and training;<ref name=ukb/> dance training;<ref>[http://www.lisajanedance.co.uk/12/Partnership_with_Sherfield_School/ "Partnership with Sherfield School"]. ''LisaJaneDance.co.uk''. Retrieved 29 February 2016.</ref> and an art gallery and artist-in-residence.<ref>[http://www.basingstokegazette.co.uk/leisure/general/10919219.first_annual_open_submission_exhibition_at_sherfield_school_will_be_unveiled_next_week/ "First annual open submission exhibition at Sherfield School will be unveiled next week"]. ''[[Basingstoke Gazette]]''. 7 January 2014.</ref> The school covers ages 3 months to 18 years, and is an [[International Baccalaureate]] school.<ref>[http://www.ibsca.org.uk/index.php/sherfield-school Sherfield School]. IB Schools and Colleges Association. Retrieved 29 February 2016.</ref>
In 2004 GEMS also acquired [[The Hampshire School, Chelsea]] in [[Chelsea, London|Chelsea]], [[London]].<ref name="id=437">[http://www.independentschools.co.uk/advanced_listing.php?school_ID=437 The Hampshire School]. ''IndependentSchools.co.uk''. Retrieved 29 February 2016.</ref> The school was founded by June Hampshire in [[Surrey]] in 1928, and moved to London in 1933.<ref name=isihampshire>[http://www.thehampshireschoolchelsea.co.uk/userfiles/files/GEMS%20Hampshire%20Final%20ISI%20Report%202015.pdf Integrated Inspection: GEMS Hampshire School]. [[Independent Schools Inspectorate]]. 2015.</ref><ref name="id=437"/> It is an independent co-educational day school for children between the ages of 3 and 13,<ref name=isihampshire/> and since 2009 has been housed in the former historic Chelsea Library, a [[listed building]].<ref name=teachinlondon>[http://www.teachinlondon.net/Employer.aspx?EmpNo=37867 GEMS Hampshire School]. ''TeachInLondon.net''. Retrieved 3 March 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.thehampshireschoolchelsea.co.uk/our-school-history-of-the-school.aspx History of the School]. ''TheHampshireSchoolChelsea.co.uk''. Retrieved 3 March 2016.</ref><ref>[https://www.goodschoolsguide.co.uk/schools/154690/the-hampshire-school-chelsea/BD4C573#tab_review The Hampshire School, Chelsea]. ''[[The Good Schools Guide]]''. Retrieved 4 March 2016.</ref>
GEMS had acquired The Hampshire School, Chelsea from [[Nord Anglia Education]].<ref name=teachinlondon/> At that time in 2004 GEMS acquired a total of 10 schools, seven of them in northern England, from Nord Anglia, which had re-focused on its nursery-school business.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/education/3836509.stm "Independent schools change hands"]. ''[[BBC News]]''. 24 June 2004.</ref> In 2007 GEMS announced the sale of [[Scarisbrick Hall School|Kingswood College]] in Lancashire to developers, citing the high costs of maintaining its premises, [[Scarisbrick Hall]], a historic 19th-century Grade I listed building;<ref>Frean, Alexandra. [http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/education/article1799574.ece "Costs force closure of no-frills private school"]. ''[[The Times]]''. 11 January 2007.</ref> local supporters purchased it and kept it open as a school.<ref>[http://www.southportvisiter.co.uk/news/southport-news/amazing-year-scarisbricks-kingswood-college-6630587 "Amazing year at Scarisbrick's Kingswood College"]. ''Southport Visiter''. 11 January 2008.</ref> By July 2013 GEMS had sold all of its schools in the north of England.<ref>[http://www.educationinvestor.co.uk/ShowArticle.aspx?ID=3415 "Exclusive: GEMS sells its northern schools portfolio"]. ''Education Investor''. 17 July 2013.</ref> After class sizes dropped to less than half, GEMS also sold Bolitho School in Penzance in 2015; GEMS had taken over the school in 2010 when it was in receivership and when pupil numbers were already in decline.<ref>Williams, John. [http://www.cornishman.co.uk/New-owners-Penzance-s-independent-Bolitho-School/story-27896266-detail/story.html "New owners for Penzance's independent Bolitho School"]. ''[[The Cornishman]]''. 30 September 2015.</ref>
In 2013 GEMS set up GEMS Learning Trust, an education charity with [[Academy (English school)|academy]]-sponsorship status approved by the [[Department for Education]], and established to run no-fee [[free school (England)|free schools]] and academies in the UK.<ref name=glt2014>[https://web.archive.org/web/20131014210142/http://www.gemslearningtrust.org/contents.php?pageid=5163 About GEMS Learning Trust]. ''GEMSLearningTrust.org''. Archived from the original on 14 October 2013.</ref> It is sponsored by GEMS Education Solutions, the public-sector management and delivery arm of GEMS Education.<ref name=glt2014/> Its Twickenham Primary Academy opened in September 2015 in [[Twickenham]], [[Richmond upon Thames]], London;<ref name=twickenhamentry>[http://www.richmond.gov.uk/gems_twickenham_primary_admissions_criteria_2016.pdf GEMS Twickenham Primary Academy Admissions Arrangements for Entry in September 2016]. ''Richmond.gov.uk''. Retrieved 5 March 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.gemslearningtrust.org/contents.php?pageid=5766 GEMS Twickenham Primary Academy]. ''GEMSLearningTrust.org''. Retrieved 5 March 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.richmondandtwickenhamtimes.co.uk/news/11290610.Two_free_primary_schools_get_Department_for_Education_approval/ "Two free primary schools In Richmond get Department for Education approval"]. ''[[Richmond and Twickenham Times]]''. 22 June 2014.</ref> beginning with [[Reception (school)|Reception]] classes it caters to children ages 4 to 11.<ref name=twickenhamentry/><ref>[http://www.gemseducation.com/choosing-a-school/find-a-school/gems-twickenham-primary-academy/ Twickenham Primary Academy]. ''GEMSeducation.com''. Retrieved 5 March 2016.</ref> Its Didcot Primary Academy, for nursery to age 11, opened in September 2016 in [[Didcot, Oxfordshire]] in a new development designed to accommodate the town's expanding population.<ref>Campbellon, Loughlan. [http://www.oxfordshireguardian.co.uk/designs-unveiled-for-new-didcot-primary-school/ "Designs unveiled for new Didcot primary school"]. ''[[Oxfordshire Guardian]]''. 4 February 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.gemseducation.com/choosing-a-school/find-a-school/gems-didcot-primary-academy/ GEMS Didcot Primary Academy]. ''GEMSeducation.com''. Retrieved 5 March 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.gemsdidcotprimary.org/learning/nursery/ GEMS Didcot Primary Academy – Nursery]. ''GEMSDidcotPrimary.org''. Retrieved 5 March 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.gemslearningtrust.org/contents.php?pageid=5607 Didcot Primary Academy]. ''GEMSLearningTrust.org''. Retrieved 5 March 2016.</ref>
===GEMS in India=== GEMS' Cambridge International School in [[Dasuya]] in [[Punjab, India|Punjab]] opened in 2006.<ref>[http://www.cisdasuya.com/schoolinformation Cambridge International School Dasuya – School Information]. ''CISDasuya.com''. Retrieved 24 October 2015.</ref> The tutelage spans from nursery through grade 12, and the school offers Indian ([[Central Board of Secondary Education|CBSE]]) and British ([[IGCSE]]) curriculums.<ref>[http://www.gemseducation.com/choosing-a-school/find-a-school/cambridge-international-school-cid/ Cambridge International School, Dasuya, India]. ''GEMSeducation.com''. Retrieved 24 October 2015.</ref> Beginning as a co-educational day school, in 2010 it added a boys' hostel for boarders.<ref>[http://school.gemsindia.co.in/Campusdiary2010.pdf "Boys' Hostel Inauguration"]. ''Cambridge International School, Dasuya Campus Diary 2010''. March/April/May 2010.</ref><ref>[http://www.cisdasuya.com/hostel Cambridge International School Dasuya – Hostel]. ''CISDasuya.com''. Retrieved 24 October 2015.</ref> The school is on an 8-acre campus and includes a variety of science, [[Information and communications technology|ICT]], sports, and extra-curricular facilities.<ref>[http://www.educationworld.in/institute/cambridge-international-school-punjab/profile.html Cambridge International School, Punjab – Profile]. ''Education World''. Retrieved 24 October 2015.</ref> ''Education World'' ranks the school No. 1 in [[Hoshiarpur district|Hoshiarpur]], No. 3 in the state of Punjab, and No. 35 in India as of 2015.<ref>[http://www.educationworld.in/institute/cambridge-international-school-punjab/profile.html Cambridge International School, Punjab – Profile: EW Ranking]. ''Education World''. Retrieved 24 October 2015.</ref> At the 2015 World Education Summit, the school won the prize for Innovation in Teaching Pedagogy.<ref>[http://wes.eletsonline.com/2015/award-winners/ World Education Summit 2015 – Award Winners]. ''Elets Online''. Retrieved 24 October 2015.</ref>
The GEMS Cambridge International School in [[Hoshiarpur]], [[Punjab, India|Punjab]] opened in 2008.<ref>[http://schools.indiadekh.com/school-gems-cambridge-international-school-8366.html Gems Cambridge International School, Hoshiarpur (Punjab)]. ''India Dekh''. Retrieved 23 October 2015.</ref> It is a day cum residential school and offers the [[Central Board of Secondary Education|CBSE]] and [[IGCSE]] curriculums.<ref>[http://www.educationworld.in/institute/gems-cambridge-international-school-hoshiarpur/profile.html GEMS Cambridge International School, Hoshiarpur – Profile: Overview]. ''Education World''. Retrieved 23 October 2015.</ref> The campus is 15 acres and includes labs for sciences and [[Information and communications technology|ICT]], studios for arts and performing arts, and indoor and outdoor sports areas and swimming pool.<ref>[http://www.vasaledu.com/gems.htm GEMS Cambridge International School, Hoshiarpur]. Vasal Education Society. Retrieved 23 October 2015.</ref> A team of students from the school and from GEMS Cambridge International School in Batala were selected to perform [[bhangra (dance)|bhangra]] dance at the cultural celebrations at the [[2012 Summer Olympics]] in London.<ref>Bariana, Sanjeev Singh. [http://www.tribuneindia.com/2012/20120717/punjab.htm#5 "Punjabi flavour: 23 students to dance to bhangra tunes at Olympics"]. ''[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]''. 17 July 2012.</ref> In 2013 cricketer [[Harbhajan Singh]] inaugurated his Institute of Cricket at the school.<ref>Bhungaon, Jagdeep. [http://www.spotnewsindia.com/2013/11/11/harbhajan-singh-opened-cricket-institute-hoshiarpur/ "Harbhajan Singh opened Cricket Institute at Hoshiarpur"]. ''Spot News India''. 11 November 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www.tribuneindia.com/2013/20131112/jal.htm#1 "Harbhajan opens cricket institute"]. ''[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]''. 12 November 2013.</ref>
GEMS International School in [[Gurgaon]] in the [[New Delhi]] area was launched in April 2010.<ref name=secondphase>[http://www.telegraphindia.com/external/display.jsp?mode=details&id=29028 "GEMS Education Increases Schools in Second Phase Expansion"] (press release). ''[[The Telegraph (Calcutta)|The Telegraph]]''. 14 November 2011.</ref> The school, which accepts toddlers through grade 12, has a five-acre campus, offers the [[Central Board of Secondary Education|CBSE]] curriculum, and is a day-boarding school.<ref name=secondphase /><ref name=click /> All classrooms have [[Smart Board]]s and [[LCD screens]].<ref name=globaleducates>[http://www.globaleducates.com/schools/view/GEMS-International-School-Gurgaon GEMS International School]. ''Global Educates''. Retrieved 20 October 2015.</ref> Sports facilities include basketball court, tennis court, football field, skating rink, and cricket field.<ref name=globaleducates /> The school has science labs, a mathematics lab, a language lab, and [[Information and communications technology|ICT]] labs.<ref name=click>[http://www.clickindia.com/detail.php?id=131205873 GEMS International School One of The Best Schools in India]. ''ClickIndia.com''. Retrieved 20 October 2015.</ref><ref name=globaleducates /> Special facilities include a dance room, music room, art & craft room, and video conferencing room.<ref name=globaleducates /> In the off-season a [[summer camp]] is available with a variety of activities for 3- to 16-year-olds, including non–GEMs students.<ref>Sharma, Mamta. [http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/gurgaon/No-vacation-summer-is-the-time-for-camps/articleshow/20163410.cms "No vacation, summer is the time for camps"]. ''[[Times of India]]''. 21 May 2013.</ref>
GEMS Akademia International School in [[Kolkata]] opened in April 2011.<ref name=secondphase /> The school has a 20-acre campus, and offers day, day-boarding, and residential options.<ref name=collegeadmission /> As of 2015, the school is ranked No. 1 in Kolkata, No. 3 in the state of [[West Bengal]], and No. 63 in India by ''Education World''.<ref name=ew>[http://www.educationworld.in/institute/gems-akademia-international-school.html EW Ranking: GEMS Akademia International School, Kolkata – 2015]. ''Education World''. Retrieved 22 October 2015.</ref> It comprises nursery through grade 12, and teaches the [[Cambridge International Examinations|CIE]] and [[CISCE]] curriculums.<ref>[http://www.educationworld.in/institute/gems-akademia-international-school.html GEMS Akademia International School – Profile: Overview]. ''Education World''. Retrieved 22 October 2015.</ref> Facilities include labs for multiple sciences, mathematics, languages, and computers; arts and performing arts facilities; and a variety of indoor and outdoor sports facilities.<ref name=collegeadmission>[http://www.collegeadmission.in/Schools/Schools_By_State/West_Bengal/Gems_Akademia_International_School.shtml GEMS Akademia International School (South Kolkata)]. ''CollegeAdmission.in''. Retrieved 22 October 2015.</ref><ref>[http://www.educationworld.in/institute/gems-akademia-international-school.html GEMS Akademia International School – Profile: Campus]. ''Education World''. Retrieved 22 October 2015.</ref>
GEMS Cambridge International School in [[Batala]], [[Punjab, India|Punjab]] opened in 2011.<ref name=jewel>[https://www.gemslearninggateway.com/parents/outbox/2011-04-April/Pages/13_GEMS_India_Creating-Models-of-Educational-Excellence.aspx "GEMS India - A jewel in the crown"]. ''GEMSLearningGateway.com''. 4 April 2011.</ref> It offers a dual curriculum of either Indian (CBSE) or British ([[Cambridge International Examinations|CIE]]) options.<ref>[http://www.oureducation.in/School/GEMS-Cambridge-international-School/3414 GEMS Cambridge International School]. ''OurEducation.in''. Retrieved 21 October 2015.</ref> Facilities include science labs, mathematics lab, computer science lab, swimming pool, indoor sports courts, dance studios, and music rooms. As of 2015 the school caters to play-school through year 7, with day and day-boarding options.<ref>[http://www.gemseducation.com/choosing-a-school/find-a-school/gems-cambridge-international-school-cib/ GEMS Cambridge International School BATALA, INDIA]. ''GEMSeducation.com''. Retrieved 21 October 2015.</ref><ref>[http://www.cisbatala.com/ Cambridge International School]. ''CISBatala.com''. Retrieved 21 October 2015.</ref>
GEMS Modern Academy in [[Gurgaon]] in the [[New Delhi]] area opened in 2014.<ref>[http://www.newindianexpress.com/cities/kochi/Stone-Laid-for-Gems-Modern-Academy/2015/05/09/article2804546.ece "Stone Laid for Gems Modern Academy"]. ''[[The New Indian Express]]''. 9 May 2015.</ref> It is a day and boarding facility for children from pre-kindergarten through grade 12.<ref name=gmag>[http://www.gemseducation.com/choosing-a-school/find-a-school/gems-modern-academy/ GEMS Modern Academy, Gurgaon, India]. ''GEMSeducation.com''. Retrieved 24 October 2015.</ref> It is a CBSE school with multiple facilities for arts, sports, sciences, technology, and academics on a five-acre campus.<ref name=gmag /> It also offers a summer camp for sports, fitness, arts, and other activities.<ref>[http://www.kidsstoppress.com/2015/05/complete-guide-to-the-best-summer-camps-workshops-for-kids-in-delhi-2015/ "Complete Guide to the Best Summer Camps & Workshops for Kids in Delhi – 2015"]. ''Kids Stop Press''. 13 May 2015.</ref>
===GEMS in sub-Saharan Africa=== GEMS opened its first school in sub-Saharan Africa in Kenya – GEMS Cambridge International School in Nairobi – in September 2012.<ref name=gaps>Ni Chonghaile, Clar. [https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2012/oct/30/nairobi-private-school-gaps-state-system "Nairobi's newest private school seeks to plug gaps in state education system"]. ''[[The Guardian]]''. 30 October 2012.</ref><ref>[[Capital FM Kenya|Capital FM]]. [http://allafrica.com/stories/201209031173.html "Kenya: Gems Cambridge International School Opens Nairobi Campus"]. ''[[AllAfrica.com]]''. 3 September 2012.</ref><ref>[http://www.gemsschools.com//media-centre/press-releases/Prime-Minister-of-Kenya-announces-first-GEMS-school-in-Africa/31 "Prime Minister of Kenya announces first GEMS school in Africa"] (press release). ''GEMSschools.com''. 28 March 2011.</ref> The school's capacity is 2,000 students, including boarders, from kindergarten through year 13.<ref name=gaps /><ref name=cin>[http://www.gemseducation.com/choosing-a-school/find-a-school/gems-cambridge-international-school-cin/ GEMS Cambridge International School, Nairobi, Kenya]. ''GEMSeducation.com''. Retrieved 3 September 2015.</ref><ref>Muema, Morris. [http://www.kenyanbusinessreview.com/480/gems-education-to-open-school-in-kenya/ "Gems Education to open school in Kenya"]. ''Kenyan Business Review''. 12 December 2011.</ref> It offers the [[National Curriculum (England, Wales and Northern Ireland)|British curriculum]], and [[IGCSE]] exams as well as British-style [[A-levels]] for graduates.<ref>[http://www.uzaze.com/directory/kenya-business-directory/Education-and-Lifestyle/schools-and-universities-in-rwanda/international-schools-in-nairobi International schools]. ''Uzaze.com''. Retrieved 3 September 2015.</ref> In 2014, a 6-lane, 400-metre [[tartan track]] was completed on the school grounds, to aid young athletes; it also allows Kenya's elite athletes to train in their speed work.<ref name=tartan>Komen, Jonathan. [http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/health/article/2000143028/upping-the-game-fourth-tartan-track-built-at-gems-cambridge-international-school-to-help-tap-talent "UPPING THE GAME: Fourth tartan track built at Gems Cambridge International School to help tap talent"]. ''[[The Standard (Kenya)|The Standard]]''. 30 November 2014.</ref> The school's numerous sports facilities also include hockey fields and basketball and tennis courts.<ref name=cin /><ref name=tartan />
In August 2015, the GEMS Cambridge International School in Nairobi launched the Lego Education Innovation Studio,<ref>[http://education.lego.com/en-us/preschool-and-school/secondary/classroom-solutions INNOVATION STUDIO]. [[Lego]] Education. ''Education.LEGO.com''. Retrieved 3 September 2015.</ref> a $55,000 facility and program in partnership with [[Lego]] Education that teaches and strengthens [[Science, technology, engineering, and mathematics|Science, Technology, Engineering, Math]], and Literacy at all age levels, and encourages critical thinking, creativity, innovation, problem-solving, and collaboration.<ref>Nyambura, Silvia. [http://www.theceomagazine-ug.com/blog/2015/08/25/gems-international-school-unveils-innovative-learning-studio/ "GEMS International School unveils innovative learning studio"]. ''CEO''. 25 August 2015.</ref><ref>Egbedi, Hadassah. [http://venturesafrica.com/kenyan-school-launches-55000-innovation-studio-for-kids/ "KENYAN SCHOOL LAUNCHES $55,000 INNOVATION STUDIO FOR KIDS"]. ''Ventures Africa''. 27 August 2015.</ref><ref>de Klee, Katie. [http://www.designindaba.com/articles/point-view/rise-tech-and-innovation-africa "The rise of tech and innovation in Africa"]. ''[[Design Indaba]]''. 3 September 2015. By</ref> The curriculum and equipment provide a hands-on learning approach that actively involves students in their own learning process.<ref>[[Capital FM Kenya|Capital FM]]. [http://allafrica.com/stories/201508241877.html "Kenya: GEMS School Partners with LEGO Education to launch Innovation Studio"]. ''[[AllAfrica.com]]''. 24 August 2015.</ref>
GEMS Cambridge International School in Uganda opened in September 2013, in the Ugandan capital city of [[Kampala]].<ref>[https://www.gemslearninggateway.com/News/Pages/GEMSisgrowinginAfrica.aspx "GEMS is growing in Africa"] (press release). ''GEMSLearningGateway.com''. 28 April 2013.</ref> It serves pupils ages 3 to 18, with the British curriculum geared toward IGCSE, [[Advanced Subsidiary level|AS-level]], and A-level qualifications.<ref>[http://www.gemscambridgeinternationalschool-kampala.com/ You are welcome]. GEMS Cambridge International School Kampala. Retrieved 3 September 2015.</ref><ref>[http://www.gemscambridgeinternationalschool-kampala.com/about-us/our-team/meet-our-principal/ Meet our Principal]. GEMS Cambridge International School Kampala. Retrieved 3 September 2015.</ref> The school also encourages an appreciation of Ugandan culture and giving back to the local community.<ref>Marriage, Rebecca. [http://www.relocatemagazine.com/articles/rmarriage-03-d3-2015-6658-education-challenges-of-an-african-education "Challenges of an African education"]. ''Relocate'' magazine. 24 March 2015.</ref> In 2015 the [[Uganda Olympic Committee]] signed a partnership with the school, to incorporate Olympic studies and training as part of the school's physical education curriculum.<ref>Isabirye, David. [http://www.kawowo.com/index.php/others/others/item/20756-uoc-gems-cambridge-sign-partnership-pact.html "UOC, GEMS CAMBRIDGE SIGN PARTNERSHIP PACT"]. ''Kawowo Sports''. 10 February 2015.</ref> The school's sports facilities also provide training grounds for a variety of national sports teams and hosting grounds for competitions.<ref>[http://www.ugandaswimming.org/1st-usf-national-inter-club-swimming-championships "1st USF National Inter-Club Swimming Championships"]. Uganda Swimming Federation. July 2015.</ref><ref>Senono, Elvis. [http://allafrica.com/stories/201507230731.html "Uganda: Mubiru Best Choice – UNF"]. ''[[AllAfrica.com]]''. 23 July 2015.</ref><ref>[http://ncs.ug/here-are-ugandas-netball-queens/ "NETBALL: Here are Uganda’s Queens"]. National Council of Sports – Uganda. 8 July 2015.</ref>
===GEMS in the United States=== In the fall of 2012 GEMS Education opened its first school in the United States, Little GEMS International-Chicago, a pre-school in [[Chicago]]'s [[Lincoln Park, Chicago|Lincoln Park]] neighborhood.<ref name=visitclark>[http://visitclarkstreet.com/little-gems-international-preschool-listing-105.php Little GEMS International Preschool]. ''VisitClarkStreet.com''. Retrieved 3 November 2016.</ref> It is an upscale preschool, and operates extended hours.<ref name=trixie>Lydersen, Kari. [http://www.chicagobusiness.com/article/20140419/ISSUE01/304199982/trixie-and-chad-have-kids "Trixie and Chad have kids!"]. ''[[Crain's Chicago Business]]''. 19 April 2014.</ref><ref name=visitclark/> It accepts ages six weeks to five years,<ref name=mommynearest/> and in addition to personal, social, emotional, creative, and intellectual development, children are exposed to world languages and digital literacy at an early age.<ref name=mommynearest>Parisi, Sarah. [https://www.mommynearest.com/edition/chicago/article/most-unique-preschools-in-the-chicago-area "Most Unique Preschools in the Chicago Area"]. ''MommyNearest.com''. 4 October 2015.</ref><ref name=trixie/><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20160313143620/http://www.chicagobusiness.com/private-school-planner/little-gems-intl-pre-school.html "Crain's 2015 Private School Planner: Little GEMS International Pre-School"]. ''[[Crain's Chicago Business]]''. Retrieved 13 March 2016.</ref>
Also in Chicago, the company opened [[GEMS World Academy-Chicago]] in September 2014.<ref name=ChicagoWorldAcademy>{{cite news|title=First GEMS World Academy K-12 School Opens in the United States|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/first-gems-world-academy-k-12-school-opens-in-the-united-states-209903261.html|work=[[PR Newswire]]|date=3 June 2013}}</ref> It is an [[International Baccalaureate]] school,<ref>[http://www.ibo.org/en/school/050949 GEMS World Academy - Chicago]. [[International Baccalaureate]]. Retrieved 10 October 2016.</ref> and is located in Chicago's [[Lakeshore East]] development.<ref>Sims, Stephanie. [http://michiganavemag.com/chicago-new-luxury-buidlings-focus-on-building-communities "Chicago's New Residences Are Focused on Building Communities"]. ''Michigan Avenue''. 3 December 2015.</ref> The preschool to eighth grade building opened in 2014, and garnered much attention for its eye-catching architecture accented with color.<ref>Pepitone, Sara. [http://www.interiordesign.net/articles/8985-iida-illinois-chapter-2015-red-awards/ "IIDA Illinois Chapter Names RED Award Winners"]. ''[[Interior Design]]''. 1 May 2015.</ref><ref>Dunlap, Aaron. [http://chicago.curbed.com/2014/8/15/10060174/gems-academy-update "Checking In On GEMS World Academy in Lakeshore East"]. ''[[Curbed|Curbed Chicago]]''. 15 August 2014.</ref><ref>American Institute of Architects Chicago. [https://books.google.com/books?id=n28PBAAAQBAJ&pg=PA31 ''AIA Guide to Chicago'']. University of Illinois Press, 2014. p. 31.</ref><ref>[[Chicago Architecture Foundation]]. [http://openhousechicago.org/sites/site/gems-world-academy/ "GEMS World Academy"]. ''[[Open House Chicago]]''. Retrieved 10 October 2016.</ref> An upper school for grades nine through 12 is scheduled to open in the fall of 2017.<ref>[http://www.gemsworldacademy-chicago.com/page/News-Detail?pk=860606&fromId=200330 "GEMS Launching Upper School Program Next Year"]. ''GEMSWorldAcademy-Chicago.com''. 10 August 2016.</ref> The school offers a global education and provides links with students around the world.<ref>Inklebarger, Timothy. [http://www.chicagoparent.com/magazines/chicago-parent/2014-august/classrooms-without-borders "Schools in Chicago are increasingly taking an international approach"]. ''Chicago Parent''. 25 August 2014.</ref><ref>Rubin, C. M. [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/c-m-rubin/the-global-search-for-edu_b_5188225.html "The Global Search for Education: The School of the Future"]. ''[[Huffington Post]]''. 22 April 2014.</ref><ref>[http://projectempathy.co/gems-chicago/ "GEMS World Academy Chicago"]. ''Project Empathy''. Retrieved 10 October 2016.</ref><ref>Beidelman, Jessica. [http://blog.theeducationpartners.com/global-citizenship-education "Global Citizenship Education"]. ''The Education Partners''. 3 June 2016.</ref><ref name=neatside>Patton, Daniel. [http://neatside.com/2016/06/gems-world-academy-chicagos-new-head-of-school/ "GEMS World Academy Chicago’s New Head of School"]. ''New Eastside News''. Summer 2016.</ref> Students receive laptops and specially equipped [[iPad]]s, which are used particularly in weekly field studies around Chicago.<ref name=neatside/><ref>Steele-Maley, Thomas. [http://www.fulcrumapp.com/blog/mobile-learning-at-gems-world-academy-chicago/ "Mobile Learning with GEMS World Academy Chicago"]. ''FulcrumApp.com''. 11 June 2015.</ref><ref>Steele-Maley, Thomas. [https://speakerdeck.com/steelemaley/gems-world-academy-chicago-field-studies "GEMS World Academy - Chicago Field Studies"]. ''SpeakerDeck.com''. 25 June 2015.</ref><ref name=crainschicago>[https://web.archive.org/web/20151025054639/http://www.chicagobusiness.com/private-school-planner/gems-world-academy-chicago.html "Crain's 2015 Private School Planner: GEMS World Academy Chicago"]. ''[[Crain's Chicago Business]]''. Retrieved 25 October 2015.</ref>
In 2014 GEMS World Academy-Chicago instituted the citywide $50,000 GEMS Education Chicago Teacher Award.<ref>Rubin, C. M. [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/c-m-rubin/the-global-search-for-edu_b_5518788.html "The Global Search for Education: Teacher I Need You"]. ''[[Huffington Post]]''. 22 June 2014.</ref> The inaugural winner, in June 2014, was Matthew Cunningham, a teacher at Frederic Chopin Elementary School in [[Ukrainian Village]] in Chicago's [[West Side, Chicago|West Side]].<ref>Runyon, Cathy. [http://www.mlive.com/jenison/index.ssf/2014/07/post_23.html "Jenison graduate named top Chicago teacher"]. ''[[MLive]]''. 24 July 2014.</ref>
In 2013 GEMS Education sought to find a location to build a school on the [[Upper East Side]] of [[New York City]]; however proceedings were eventually abandoned amidst litigation relating to property contracts.<ref name=NewYorkLawSuits>{{cite news|last1=Pincus|first1=Adam|title=SL Green is latest to sue over failed UES school project|url=http://therealdeal.com/blog/2014/08/29/sl-green-is-latest-to-sue-over-failed-ues-school-project/|accessdate=1 January 2015|work=The Real Deal|date=29 August 2014}}</ref>
In the early 2010s GEMS' consultancy arm, GEMS Education Solutions, partnered in managing some U.S. schools. In 2009 Manny Rivera, at the time CEO of GEMS Education Solutions and GEMS Americas, formed Global Partnership Schools with former New York City Schools Chancellor [[Rudy Crew]].<ref>Lambeck, Linda Conner. [http://www.ctpost.com/local/article/More-information-sought-on-firm-that-s-hired-to-534471.php "More information sought on firm that's hired to 'restart' Harding high"]. ''[[Connecticut Post]]''. 23 June 2010.</ref><ref>[http://www.newlondon.org/common/pages/DisplayFile.aspx?itemId=462349 "New London Public Schools Welcomes Dr. Manuel J. Rivera as Superintendent of Schools"]. New London Public Schools. ''NewLondon.org''. 3 February 2015.</ref><ref name=reverabio>{{cite web|title=Dr. Manuel J. Rivera – Biography|url=http://www.nancyonnorwalk.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/Rivera-Background-Materials.pdf|website=NancyOnNorwalk.com|accessdate=6 January 2015}}</ref> Global Partnership Schools, in partnership with GEMS Education Solutions, and financed by newly available three-year federal [[School Improvement Grant]]s (SIG), managed some previously failing schools in the U.S. beginning in 2010.<ref name=hechingerklein/> Results, as with many SIG recipients from 2010–2012, were mixed;<ref name=hechingerbrownstein>Brownstein, Andrew. [http://hechingerreport.org/trying-to-turn-around-schools-while-slashing-budgets/ "Trying to turn around schools while slashing budgets"]. ''[[The Hechinger Report]]''. 15 April 2012.</ref><ref name=hechingerklein>Klein, Alyson. [http://hechingerreport.org/whats-the-payoff-for-3-billion-in-school-improvement-grants/ "What’s the payoff for $4.6 billion in School Improvement Grants?"]. ''[[The Hechinger Report]]''. 15 April 2012.</ref><ref> *Jochim, Ashley. [https://www.aei.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/Jochim_FINAL.pdf "Carrots, Sticks, and Sermons: How Policy Shapes Educational Entrepreneurship"]. [[American Enterprise Institute]]. From: Center on Reinventing Public Education, [[University of Washington]]. 24 June 2015. *{{cite news|title=City schools with federal turnaround grants have mixed results|url=http://articles.baltimoresun.com/2012-04-16/news/bs-md-turnaround-schools-20120416_1_city-schools-global-partnership-schools-sig-schools|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160306215902/http://articles.baltimoresun.com/2012-04-16/news/bs-md-turnaround-schools-20120416_1_city-schools-global-partnership-schools-sig-schools|archivedate=6 March 2016|work=The Baltimore Sun|date=16 April 2012}} *{{cite web|last1=Conner Lambeck|first1=Linda|title=How Bridgeport High Schools fared on CAPT|url=http://blog.ctnews.com/education/2012/07/25/how-bridgeport-high-schools-fared-on-capt/|website=Education Matters|accessdate=7 January 2015}} *[http://www.gao.gov/products/GAO-12-373 SCHOOL IMPROVEMENT GRANTS: Education Should Take Additional Steps to Enhance Accountability for Schools and Contractors]. [[Government Accountability Office]]. GAO-12-373: 11 April 2012. </ref> in August 2012 the company declined to renew its contract with one school district.<ref name=DenverPostJan2012>{{cite news|last1=Augé|first1=Karen|title=Five failing schools to lose money supposed to help them improve|url=http://www.denverpost.com/2012/10/31/five-failing-schools-to-lose-money-supposed-to-help-them-improve/|accessdate=7 January 2015|work=Denver Post|date=11 January 2012}}</ref> The combined partnership company also sponsored two new [[charter schools]] in Ohio called Believe to Achieve Academies beginning in the fall of 2012; they closed in the spring of 2014 due to inability to meet enrollment goals.<ref name=cantonRepMay2014>{{cite news|last1=Young|first1=Kelli|title=Believe to Achieve Academy to close June 30|url=http://www.cantonrep.com/article/20140509/News/140509038|accessdate=6 January 2015|work=CantonRep.com|publisher=Canton Rep|date=9 May 2014}}</ref><ref name=BelieveAchieveClosures>{{cite web|title=Believe to Achieve Academies (Canton and Cleveland) to close|url=http://www.clevelandta.org/sites/default/files/news/Ohio%20Council%20of%20Community%20Schools%20-%20Believe%20to%20Achieve%20Acadamies%20to%20Close.pdf|website=|accessdate=6 January 2015}}</ref><ref name=reverabio/><ref> *[https://gps.tedk12.com/hire/viewjob.aspx?jobid=488 Math & Science Teacher, 6th Grade: Charter School, Cleveland, OH]. Global Partnership Schools. ''GPS.tedk12.com''. January 2013. *[https://gps.tedk12.com/hire/viewjob.aspx?jobid=502 Math & Science Teacher, Middle School: Charter School, Canton, OH]. Global Partnership Schools. ''GPS.tedk12.com''. January 2013. *[https://gps.tedk12.com/hire/Index.aspx Welcome; Job Listings] Global Partnership Schools. ''GPS.tedk12.com''. April 2013. *[https://www.linkedin.com/in/brigid-shea-17062628 Brigid Shea] at [[LinkedIn]]. Retrieved 8 November 2016. *Branch, Alfred. [http://norwalk.dailyvoice.com/schools/norwalk-picks-ex-resident-manuel-rivera-as-school-superintendent/584003/ "Norwalk Picks Ex-Resident Manuel Rivera As School Superintendent"]. ''[[The Daily Voice (U.S. hyperlocal news)|Norwalk Daily Voice]]''. 1 July 2013. </ref>
===GEMS in Europe=== GEMS' first school in continental Europe is the GEMS World Academy-Etoy, located in [[Étoy, Switzerland|Etoy, Switzerland]] in the [[Lake Geneva]] area between Geneva and Lausanne.<ref>Curtis, Malcolm. [http://www.thelocal.ch/20121104/dubai-firm-to-open-162-million-franc-school "Dubai firm to open 162-million-franc school"] {{webarchive |url=https://www.webcitation.org/6goj4R8XU?url=http://www.thelocal.ch/20121104/dubai-firm-to-open-162-million-franc-school |date=16 April 2016 }}. ''[[The Local]]''. 4 November 2012.</ref><ref name=lunch /> The school opened in the fall of 2013 for students from pre-school through grade 8,<ref name=style>Demaurex, Jane Tenorio. [http://www.swissstyle.com/gems-world-academy-etoy/ "GEMS World Academy-Etoy: Switzerland's New, World-Class International School"]. ''Swiss Style''. 2012.</ref> with plans to expand to grade 12 and up to 1,000 students.<ref name=lunch>Wallace, Ellen. [http://genevalunch.com/2012/11/01/new-intl-school-to-open-in-vaud-in-september/ "New int’l school to open in Vaud in September"]. ''Geneva Lunch''. 1 November 2012.</ref> The school, which is an English-speaking school with an added strong emphasis on French, caters to the international populace of the area, as well as to local Swiss families seeking an international education for their children.<ref name=lunch /><ref name=detaille>Modoux, François. [http://www.letemps.ch/Page/Uuid/00f69fd2-9275-11e2-929e-fe962a42a8e0/La_future_%C3%A9cole_priv%C3%A9e_dEtoy_d%C3%A9taille_son_plan_p%C3%A9dagogique "La future école privée d’Etoy détaille son plan pédagogique"]. ''[[Le Temps]]''. 22 March 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www.vaudfamille.ch/N411463/gems-world-academy-etoy.html GEMS World Academy-Etoy]. ''VaudFamille.ch''. Retrieved 26 September 2015.</ref> The upscale school also offers merit-based scholarships of 25% to 100% tuition reimbursement for local students.<ref>[http://www.lacote.ch/articles/regions/district-de-morges/etoy-l-ecole-privee-gems-veut-aussi-accueillir-des-eleves-talentueux-de-la-region-300116 "Etoy: l'école privée GEMS veut aussi accueillir des élèves talentueux de la région"]. ''La Côte''. 21 November 2013.</ref><ref name=unlimited>Lehmann, Peter. [http://media.gemseducation.com/media/7994/gwe-media-coverage-2014-swissstyle-jan20147054108.pdf "GEMS World Academy: Language Unlimited"]. ''Swiss Style''. Issue 231: 2013. pp. 70–71.</ref>
GEMS World Academy-Etoy is an International Baccalaureate school, and includes specialised facilities such as a World Language Learning Centre,<ref name=unlimited /> a large international and high-tech library,<ref name=library>Held, Kristina. [http://www.swissstyle.com/a-well-rounded-education-for-the-globally-minded/ "A Well Rounded Education for the Globally Minded"]. ''Swiss Style''. 2014.</ref> radio and TV studios, a music centre, and a dyslexia support center.<ref name=style /><ref name=library /><ref>Corthesy, Joy. [http://www.swissstyle.com/educating-the-whole-child/ "GEMS World Academy-Etoy"]. ''Swiss Style''. 2013.</ref> Many of the facilities are also open to the public.<ref name=nouvelle>Mathez de Senger, Chantal. [http://www.bilan.ch/economie-les-plus-de-la-redaction/la-cote-accueille-une-nouvelle-ecole-privee "La Côte accueille une nouvelle école privée"]. ''Bilan''. 1 May 2013.</ref> Its new-construction sports facilities, which opened in May 2015, include a 25-meter swimming pool, a large multi-sport court for basketball, netball, handball, badminton, football, etc., a climbing wall, a fitness room, and a dance studio, and these are available for use by local groups and businesses outside of school hours.<ref>[http://www.agefi.com/ageficom/accueil/detail/edition/online/article/lecole-internationale-gems-world-academy-a-inaugure-son-nouveau-centre-sportif-qui-beneficiera-a-lensemble-de-la-region-morgienne-397651.html "GEMS: nouveau centre sportif inauguré à Etoy"]. ''[[:fr:L'AGEFI|L'AGEFI]]''. 4 May 2015.</ref><ref name=sports /> The school aims to distinguish itself as providing a holistic, innovative education focused on forming global citizens with an international vision and enhanced problem-solving skills.<ref name=detaille /><ref name=unlimited /><ref name=library /><ref name=sports>[http://www.swissstyle.com/gems-world-academy-etoy-celebrates-the-opening-of-its-new-sports-centre/ "GEMS World Academy-Etoy celebrates the opening of its new Sports Centre"]. ''Swiss Style''. 2015.</ref><ref>[http://media.gemseducation.com/media/8582/20150618-lhebdo-guideecoleprivees.pdf "Guide 2015: Quelle école privée pour vos enfants?"]. ''[[L'Hebdo]]''. 18 June 2015. p. 49.</ref>
In November 2013 GEMS Education acquired its first school in France, [[:fr:École des Roches|Ecole des Roches]], a prestigious 60-acre international boarding school founded in 1899 in Normandy.<ref name=leading>[http://ameinfo.com/finance-and-economy/economy/education/leading-french-institute-ecole-des-roches-becomes-part-gems-family-schools/ "Leading French institute Ecole des Roches becomes part of GEMS family of schools"]. ''[[AMEinfo.com]]''. 1 March 2014.</ref><ref name=rever /> The top-tier school, for students age 6 to 19, caters to a clientele from over 100 countries.<ref name=leading /><ref>Lalay, Jean-Christophe. [http://www.ouest-france.fr/aux-roches-les-riches-vont-lecole-3687025 "Aux Roches, les riches vont à l'école"]. ''[[Ouest-France]]''. 12 September 2015.</ref><ref>Lalay, Jean-Christophe. [http://www.ouest-france.fr/leditiondusoir/data/576/reader/reader.html#!preferred/1/package/576/pub/577/page/10 "Dans l’Eure, une école pour enfants très riches"]. ''[[Ouest-France]]''. 11 September 2015.</ref> GEMS invested €5{{nbsp}}million for a five-year large-scale expansion, redevelopment, and modernization of the school, making additions including new class buildings and dormitories, a school restaurant, a large entertainment auditorium featuring a theatre with a symphony orchestra pit, a music studio, and a large sports complex. The sports complex includes an Olympic swimming pool, ice rinks, 14 tennis courts, numerous sports fields for [[association football|football]], rugby, and squash, martial arts studios, and [[karting]] tracks; and a rebuild of the school's runway to re-open its flight training.<ref name=rever>Laïdi, Malik. [http://www.lechorepublicain.fr/eure-et-loir/actualite/pays/pays-drouais/2014/03/22/dubai-fait-rever-lecole-des-roches_1929072.html "Dubaï fait rêver l’École des Roches"]. ''[[:fr:L'Écho républicain|L'Écho républicain]]''. 22 March 2014.</ref><ref name=lifting /><ref>Khosrovani, Kamran. [http://www.aern.fr/node/55075 "ÉCOLE DES ROCHES et GEMS EDUCATION"]. ''Les Anciens de l'École des Roches Normandie''. 10 May 2014.</ref><ref name=afrique /><ref name=voile /> GEMS made the primary school all-digital, added new language courses, and added France's first International Baccalaureate curriculum;<ref name=voile>Rebours, Laurent. [http://www.lereveilnormand.fr/2015/06/17/ecole-des-roches-le-voile-se-leve-sur-de-grands-projets/ "Ecole des Roches: le voile se lève sur de grands projets"]. ''[[:fr:Le Réveil normand|Le Réveil normand]]''. 19 June 2015.</ref><ref name=journee>[http://www.paris-normandie.fr/detail_communes/articles/3432516/une-journee-de-festivites "Verneuil-sur-Avre: une journée de festivités à l’École des Roches"]. ''[[:fr:Paris Normandie|Paris Normandie]]''. 15 June 2015.</ref><ref name=samedi>[http://www.lereveilnormand.fr/2015/03/25/lecole-des-roches-ouvre-ses-portes-samedi-28-mars/ "L'Ecole des Roches ouvre ses portes samedi 28 mars"]. ''[[:fr:Le Réveil normand|Le Réveil normand]]''. 25 March 2015.</ref> Ecole des Roches now offers a combination of the British and French curriculums.<ref name=afrique>Clémençot, Julien. [http://www.jeuneafrique.com/45966/societe/lites-africaines-l-cole-des-riches-euh-des-roches/ "Élites africaines: l’École des riches, eu ... des roches!"] ''[[Jeune Afrique]]''. 29 August 2014.</ref><ref name=voile /><ref>[http://www.gemseducation.com/choosing-a-school/find-a-school/ecole-des-roches/ Ecole Des Roches]. ''GEMSeducation.com''. Retrieved 23 September 2015.</ref>
GEMS announced an intention to double or triple Ecole des Roches's 400-student boarding and day enrolment over five years.<ref name=rever /><ref name=lifting>Laïdi, Malik. [http://www.lechorepublicain.fr/eure-et-loir/actualite/pays/pays-drouais/2015/06/20/la-prestigieuse-ecole-des-roches-de-verneuil-sur-avre-prepare-son-lifting_11489233.html "La prestigieuse école des Roches, de Verneuil-sur-Avre, prépare son lifting"]. ''[[:fr:L'Écho républicain|L'Écho républicain]]''. 20 June 2015.</ref><ref>Foucault, Johann. [http://www.lereveilnormand.fr/2014/12/29/lecole-des-roches-va-creer-plus-de-150-emplois/ "L'Ecole des Roches va créer plus de 150 emplois"]. ''[[:fr:Le Réveil normand|Le Réveil normand]]''. 29 December 2014.</ref> 2014 was the first year of GEMS operation of the school,<ref name=journee /> and as of 2015, it also offers French immersion courses for international students during the summer, French-immersion exchange programmes throughout the year, and summer English courses.<ref name=leading /><ref name=samedi />
===GEMS in Southeast Asia=== In September 2014 the company opened [[GEMS World Academy (Singapore)|GEMS World Academy Singapore]], its first school in [[Southeast Asia]].<ref>[https://www.gemslearninggateway.com/News/Pages/NewGEMSWorldAcademy-SingaporewillbecomefirstschoolinSoutEastAsiatojoinexclusiveglobalnetworkofschools.aspx "OPENING IN SEPTEMBER 2014"] (press release). ''GEMSLearningGateway.com''. 27 May 2013. </ref> It has an international curriculum, and is an International Baccalaureate school, offering the Cambridge International curriculum [[Cambridge International Examinations|CIE]]/[[IGCSE]] as well.<ref name=expat /> The school's $220-million campus is projected to be fully completed by 2017, when it will be able to take in up to 3,000 students aged three to 18.<ref name=enrol2017>Davie, Sandra. [http://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/education/gems-world-academy-to-enrol-3000-students-here-by-2017 "Gems World Academy to enrol 3,000 students here by 2017"]. ''[[The Straits Times]]''. 8 April 2015.</ref>
The school focuses on all-round development, including language development and commitment to community and service.<ref name=expat>[http://www.expatliving.sg/kids/Schools-in-Singapore-Four-education-options-for-expats-83445.ece "Schools in Singapore: Four education options for expats"]. ''Expat Living Singapore''. 6 April 2015.</ref> All pupils up to age 11 are provided with a violin or cello, there are sound-proof studios for one-on-one music lessons, and there are also multiple orchestra groups and bands.<ref name=enrol2017 /> Sports facilities include an Olympic-sized swimming pool, all-weather playing field, multi-purpose gym, and climbing wall.<ref name=enrol2017 /><ref name=huge>[http://www.expatliving.sg/Living_In_Singapore/schools/International-schools-in-Singapore-HUGE-GUIDE-2014-60449.ece "International schools in Singapore: HUGE GUIDE 2014"]. ''Expat Living Singapore''. 19 September 2014.</ref> The school has audio and film recording studios, and a 750-seat auditorium and a planetarium are scheduled to be completed by 2017.<ref name=enrol2017 /><ref name=huge /> Language studies in this multilingual location include [[ESL]] support for non-native English speakers, 30 minutes daily of [[Standard Chinese|Chinese]] for students under age 6, and after that continued study of either Chinese, Spanish, or French.<ref name="js.com">[http://spring-js.com/singapore/3071/ "GEMS World Academy (Singapore)"]. ''Spring''. 25 March 2014.</ref><ref>[http://singaporebaby.com/gems-world-academy-in-a-nutshell/ "GEMS World Academy in a Nutshell"]. ''Singapore Baby''. 22 May 2015.</ref> The school fosters leadership skills and innovative thinking;<ref name=inside>[http://www.itseducation.asia/singapore/inside-schools-sg.htm "News and Views – Inside Schools in Singapore"]. ''ITS Education Asia''. Retrieved 9 October 2015.</ref> an adapted [[Reggio Emilia approach]] is used for younger students,<ref>[http://www.singaporeexpats.com/guides-for-expats/pre-schools.htm Guides for Expats – Preschools]. ''Singapore Expats''. Retrieved 9 October 2015.</ref> and secondary-school students assist teachers with arts, drama, music, and special presentations and celebrations.<ref name=inside />
In September 2015, GEMS opened GEMS International School Pearl City, in [[Penang, Malaysia]].<ref name=welcomes /> The school is for ages three to 18, and follows the British National Curriculum leading to the IGCSE/CIE and AS/A-level qualifications.<ref name=welcomes>Sue-Chern, Looi. [http://www.themalaysianinsider.com/citynews/georgetown/article/mainland-penang-welcomes-its-first-international-school "Mainland Penang welcomes its first international school"]. ''[[The Malaysian Insider]]''. 28 September 2015.</ref><ref name=ready>Tan, Christopher. [http://www.thestar.com.my/Metro/Community/2015/03/25/Final-cut-and-polish-GEMS-International-School-to-be-ready-in-time-for-September-intake/ "GEMS International School to be ready in time for September intake"]. ''[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]''. 25 March 2015.</ref> It also accommodates the Malaysian Education Ministry guidelines and teaches [[Malaysian language]], Mandarin, Malaysian social studies, and Islamic and moral studies.<ref name=welcomes/><ref name=ready /> It is the first international school in [[Seberang Perai|Mainland Penang]].<ref name=welcomes /> Facilities include a theatre, music and art rooms, a dance studio, sport halls, a football field, swimming pools, and basketball courts.<ref name=welcomes/> The school plans to grow to 1,500 students within five years, eventually accommodating 3,000 students.<ref name=welcomes/><ref>[http://www.theborneopost.com/2013/12/27/tambun-indah-attracts-international-school-into-flagship-township-pearl-city/ "Tambun Indah attracts international school into flagship township Pearl City"]. ''[[The Borneo Post]]''. 27 December 2013.</ref>
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.gemseducation.com/}}

revision.comment: Changed reference for Tower section to specific page.
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2014}} {{Use Australian English|date=March 2014}} {{Coord|31.356184|S|115.712696|E|display=title}} [[File:Gravity Discovery Centre (logo).jpg|thumb|300px|right|The Gravity Discovery Centre logo]]
The '''Gravity Discovery Centre and Observatory''' is a "hands-on" Science education, astronomy, Aboriginal culture and tourist centre, situated on the site of the Gravity precinct, near [[Gingin]], north of [[Perth, Western Australia]].
The centre is operated by The Gravity Discovery Centre Foundation Board Inc and provides information and displays regarding [[physics]], [[astronomy]] and Australian Aboriginal Culture specialising in [[gravity]] and [[cosmology]]. The site of the public centre is located in pristine Western Australian bushland.
The Department of Biodiversity Conservation and Attractions manages the bushland surrounding the Discovery Centre and the observatory, and strives to keep the area untouched (from weeds, litter, etc.). The surrounding area is abundant in seasonal wildflowers.
In 2005 the Gravity Discovery Centre was awarded the [[Eureka Prize]] for "promoting [the] understanding of science."<ref>http://eureka.australianmuseum.net.au/7537F9BD-EB56-2006-84C9841C04AA1401</ref> The GDC is a significant Western Australian asset.
==Exhibits==
*The Discovery Centre :*Magnetic Skateboard :*AIGO Model :*Bernoulli Ball :*Space Capsule :*
*The Cosmology Gallery, topped with a {{convert|20|m|ft}} diameter Buckyball dome :*Niobe, the first [[southern hemisphere]] [[gravitational wave detector]]. :*[[Timeline]] from the [[Big Bang]] to the present :*[[Penrose tiles|Penrose Floor]] :*[[Astrophotography]] :*The Australian Shaman Exhibition :*Coherence to Chaos Exhibition :*Multicultural artwork
*Southern Cross Cosmos Centre, home to the [[GDC Observatory]] *The Zadko Telescope, a robotic optical telescope.
==The Leaning Tower of Gingin==
[[File:Leaning tower of gingin.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The Leaning Tower of Gingin]]
The Leaning Tower of Gingin is a purpose built {{convert|45|m|ft|}} tall steel [[inclined tower]], designed so that visitors can recreate the experiments of [[Galileo Galilei]]. There are 222 steps to the top from where balloons filled with water can be dropped through chutes. The tower leans at an angle of 15 degrees and held in place by 180 tons of [[concrete]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://gravitycentre.com.au/leaning-tower/|title=Leaning Tower of Gingin - Gravity Discovery Centre|work=Gravity Discovery Centre|access-date=2018-08-11|language=en-US}}</ref> The drop tower is also used by the [[YouTube]] channel "How Ridiculous" for various drop tests.<ref>https://www.youtube.com/user/whoisjimmy/featured</ref>
== Wildflowers ==
{{Empty section|date=November 2015}}
==References== {{Reflist}}
